Give them a try.

name: Dan O
text: Unisys Corporation is no longer at this location.

name: Sid Collins
text: As a 16 year customer, I can say their platform is good, but they are expensive for non-profits.  Be careful if you decide to switch companies,  it’s costly to have access to your historical information.

resp.text: Sid, we appreciate your partnership with Daxko. If there is anything we can do to help support the mission of your Y in the future, please let us know.

name: Alex
text: Wonderful place to work. Daxko takes care of their customers and their people. I could not ask for better teammates. I love what I do here, and I love what Daxko has done for me.

name: Jessica Jones
text: Look out! Daxko could very well be the next Theranos.  I'm not saying their product is TERRIBLE (but I'm also not saying it's not),  just be careful when purchasing their product. Customer support is a nightmare, and from what I understand, it starts from their top command.

resp.text: Jessica, we’re sorry your partnership with Daxko hasn’t been to the quality that we strive for daily. Our support team is dedicated to our customers and their growth. As a current customer, please reach out so we can help you with these challenges as much as possible.

name: Tom Malone
text: The leadership of this company is very qualified and helpful.

name: Shaun Staton
text: I love working at Daxko. The people here are top-notch and really care about their careers and each other.

name: Daniel Van Fleet
text: Daxko's culture, team members, leadership, and solutions make it a great workplace. I've been a team member for more than 11 years, and I'm still very thankful for that blessing.

name: ANONY MOUSE
text: Sucks to work here. It wasn't great, but then GI Partners bought us out and now it is even worse. Avoid at all cost.

resp.text: Anony, we're very sorry your time at Daxko hasn't been to the standard that we aim for daily. Our culture and our company is a fantastic fit for some and not for others. We hope that you give specific feedback to our people team to help them make improvements so that you, your teammates, and future employees have a great experience making the world a healthier and happier place at Daxko.

name: Andrea
text: Friendly, happy folks, & an interesting work space that fosters collaboration and teamwork.

name: Doug Taylor
text: I'd give a zero if I could. This service is shady at best. I bought a car for my daughter recently and could not obtain insurance from my carrier  because of a report they received from this company. They claim that an auction employee reported "frame damage" back in 2008, yet no such damage was ever reported to the owner's insurance nor was it noted on the title. CARMAX and several other reporting agencies didn't have a record of the damage either. When I questioned Red Mountain Customer Service I was told that they are under no obligation to share their reports with other agencies, but that she would follow up with me. The next day I received this email response: "The Auction that sold your daughter’s car in 2008 reports that the damage was to the left apron which was noted as severe damage. I have attached a copy of the AutoCheck vehicle history for your use."  The report states "Frame Damage", not "Apron Damage". Huge difference. So... they reserve the right to "report" whatever they want (accurate or not), thus creating issues like I now have with the car, while withholding information from other reporting agencies that if accurate, could be a potential safety issue to the consumer. The rep I spoke with at this company was very friendly, but evasive when I pushed her about the shady reporting. This is a very shady company.

name: ngoehringer
text:
This place is beyond slimey.
Wrong information into their system about an accident while the vehicle was in my possession.  Now i am paying the price. Expect no help from staff.
Talk to your primary insurance to make sure they aren't using companies like this one.

Buyer BEWARE . Stay far away.

name: Jessica Harrell
text: Always super helpful when I call

name: Stacie Gilham
text: After setting up my laptop, I was unable to change any settings requiring an administrator password due to Yeltek having themselves as the administrator.i emailed them an no response. I called and had a return called stating I could use my laptop without the administrator password. That is true, under the guest account they set up for me. I want full control over the laptop I purchased, not for Yeltek to have any account on it. I have since sent another email requesting the administrator password and left two more messages due to no one ever there answering the phone. Still no response. Bad service. I wouldn't recommend this company to anyone.

resp.text: The laptop was invoiced to Kennedy Galvanizing. YELTEK has reached several times to their office (Allen) and called Dollie/Stacie at home. We have spoken to Dollie (Stacie grandmother) and asked for her to contact us. We have attempted to guide Dollie over the phone what she needs to do. We have recommended dropping the device by the office to make this small change. We have not received follow up from Dollie or Stacie.

text: Has raised several iPads for my grandchildren!  Always did a good job.  Recently need a fix for my iPad and she fixed it for free!   Thanks so much.

name: Gigi
text: The guy I spoke with was friendly and professional. I greatly appreciated his honesty when he was unable to repair our ancient phone and offered helpful suggestions.

name: Casey riley
text:
I went into this store with a broken phone screen, everything still worked I just needed a new screen! Only reason I wanted to replace the screen is because it was cracked will glass falling out (yeah I broke it good). Breaking the phone is beside the point because at some point we all do and that is why this place is even in business!
After being in the store an hour I was going to leave with my phone in working condition and noticed that the home button was super sensitive and was going crazy (I knew a risk with the home button was possible but it was pushing itself and the phone was going nuts) Carly the girl I was working with was absolutely wonderful (customer service wise and was super sweet). She was concerned so she opened the phone back up (big mistake) because the touch and the home button went completely out! She was great a working to try and fix the problem and then partnered with her boss who said she wasn't sure what could have happened but they could send the phone off but they thought the phone had touch HiC which is a disease on the phone that means the motherboard of the phone came unmicrosauded to the phone itself (I was told this could have happened when I dropped the phone which is crazy cause the phone worked up until they worked on it). Carly's Boss made sure that Carly relayed to me that they would send it off but the repair was on me and my wallet which I still don't understand. After and update and a factory restore on the phone I left it over night so that the manager could look at it herself.
The next morning I got a call from the Manager and she stated she didn't know what was wrong with the phone but the could send it off but again I had already been told I would have to pay for the repair. She said I will put all the original pieces on the phone and you can come pick your phone up (because I wasn't going to send it off and have to pay for a repair to he done to a phone that just needed a simple screen replacement when I went into the store).
What this boils down to is that I Fix and Repair tore my phone up and wasn't willing to pay for the repair and wanted to send my phone off and it would never be the same again. People we take our phones into these places to intrust the individuals will do the repair and the phone will work (keep in mind I mentioned earlier I knew there were risk but no reason as to why my phone doesn't work now when it was working fine when I went into the store) This company in no way shape or form ever admitted to me that they screwed my phone up and took no responsibility in it. After being told I would be responsible for the repair I realized these people do not need to have a contract with IPhone if they aren't going to replace the phone after they basically demolished a phone and wouldn't fess up and take the responsibility. I have looked into this company and know that they can have their apple contract pulled if enough people have issues with them. I urge you to write a review if they have messed your phone up and didn't want to take the responsibility! Do it so people won't go through what I have been through! The don't deserve your business and I will never grace their door again!

name: Jamie Delveccio
text: I've had the honor and opportunity to know and work with Brandon Morris and the Barons' Inc team as their QuickBooks Channel Manager here at Intuit QuickBooks for over 5 years. Barons' Inc. is one of our fastest growing and highest valued QuickBooks Solution Providers, providing excellent service to our QuickBooks customers, and mentorship to our fellow QuickBooks Solution Providers. He also serves as a member in our QuickBooks Advisory Council, working directly with our QuickBooks leadership and product developers to lend his experience and feedback. I can't say enough about Brandon and Barons' Inc, we're incredibly fortunate to have him on our team!

resp.text: The honor and opportunity is all ours Jamie!  We love being in the QSP program, and love the direction and advice that you provide as well!  Thanks for all that you do!

text: Absolutely terrible.   All of Pitney Bowes machines are down half the time or more. I will never use them again .  Ever.

name: Sean Flynn
text: A great alternative to Comdata/Trendar. This is a great company where people care about their customers.

name: Joey Ruiz
text: Nice place to work in.

name: David Santos
text:
What can I say, well to start with, I was not ready for the change to a New Company because I have been with Xerox for over 25 + Years. I have always been treated very well from them so, NO I did not want to change. After a while of thinking about it SEVERAL MONTHS and my Son hammering me with the RJ YOUNG name, I did it. I purchased a machine from RJ YOUNG.
At first I was skeptical and to be honest I really didn't want to give it a chance (The Machine), but I did and after several months and barely using the machine I starting coming more around it and using it a little more & more. Then I began to really like it because it really printed so nice and pretty fast. It only took me  8 to 10 months to like it but you have to understand I WAS A XEROX Man and I thought there was NOTHING out there but Xerox. The Xerox machine has ALWAYS  performed outstanding and the SERVICE was the best, I was spoiled from that. However, I found out that there was more out there than XEROX! I found out that RJ YOUNG was REAL and believe me they have made a believer out of me. The Service that I thought would not compare to XEROX, has showed me they are just as good and if not BETTER. I never thought I would say that but it is so true. I can not believe how fast the Service Technicians reply to the service calls. They are always polite, and get me back up and running in a very quickly manner. They have such good personalities and a smile! As for the Ladies at the Home Office, Oh My How can you NOT like them. They are AMAZING. They always tell me they will have my supplies on the way or a Technician asap. IT IS JUST SO HARD TO PUT IN WORDS what RJ Young has done for my business. This is a very caring company and to be honest I am so glad that I have some of their product and that I was introduced to the World outside of XEROX. RICO machines have made my life SO MUCH Better and I am so happy that I have changed. If you are not a part of RJ YOUNG, you are probably missing out on good PEOPLE and Great Machines.
David Santos,
Santos Printing Co.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your feedback, David! We truly appreciate it.

name: SBNABN Nelson
text: RJ Young was very helpful! They were very knowledgeable and worked quick to help deliver and service our devices! I highly recommend them!

name: Tom Sommerville
text:
Great Company, top quality products, service and support. More that a Copier Company, They sell Technology, gear. and the Latest Security Camera;s Printers from desktop to Print Shop.
AV installations, Managed Print and Network Services. Full line of PPE.

text: Good software for a small contractor or business that doesn't do large bidding projects. It is not capable of handling the heavy highway work I was lead to believe it could. I purchased it and canceled it after a year of trying to make it work. I highly recommend a trial period before purchasing.
